subject: Real Estate
title: The Mortgage-Backed Security
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Mortgage-Backed Security usable.

hook.text: Your monthly mortgage payment doesn't stay with the bank. It gets bundled and sold to investors.

buildup.text: Banks package thousands of mortgages into securities and sell them on Wall Street for instant cash.

discovery.text: This frees up capital for more lending. One bank can fund far more homes than its deposits allow.

twist.text: In 2008, risky mortgages were bundled with safe ones. When defaults spiked, nobody knew which were which.

climax.text: The entire global financial system froze because the world's safest investment suddenly wasn't.

punchline.text: Bundling risk didn't reduce it â€” it hid it.

quiz.question: What was the problem with mortgage-backed securities in 2008?
options: Risky and safe mortgages were mixed together
